data.text:
Subject: IMF – Intersubsidiary Movement Form

From: Mary Ann Alt, Lois Grimes, Ruth Marriott

During the C&T Conference, there were many questions that arose regarding IMF. Thanks to Shari Wojtowicz-Schalwig, , President Local 7250, who was able to raise even more issues, we have been able to clarify most of the concerns. This posting should help you to better understand the IMF process.

You will find two documents attached. These documents are from AT&T’s website. The first document is called the Intersubsidiary Movement Form. This package contains the terms and conditions of the process, the Intersubsidiary Movement Form (IMF_form.pdf) information on how to participate. Currently, Legacy T employees can use the IMF to move to the following entities:

AT&T Midwest

Illinois Bell Telephone Company

Indiana Bell Telephone Company, Inc.

The Ohio Bell Telephone Company

Wisconsin Bell, Inc.

Michigan Bell Telephone Company

Ameritech Advanced Data Services of Illinois, Inc.

Ameritech Services, Inc.

AT&T Services, Inc.

AT&T WEST (Nevada & California)

Pacific Bell Telephone Company

Nevada Bell Telephone Company

SBC Long Distance, Inc.

SBC Advanced Solutions, Inc.

SBC Internet Services (Pacific Bell Internet Services)

Pacific Bell Info Services (Messaging Customer Care Operations)

AT&T Services, Inc.

SBC Global Services, Inc. (Datacomm)

Southwestern Bell Video Services (Pacific Bell Home Entertainment)

AT&T EAST

Southern New England Telephone Company

SNET Diversified Group, Inc.

The Woodbury Telephone Company

SNET America, Inc

SBC Advanced Solutions, Inc

AT&T Services, Inc.

AT&T SOUTHWEST

Southwestern Bell Telephone, L.P.

SBC Advanced Solutions, Inc.

SBC Internet Services

AT&T Services, Inc.

AT&T MESSAGING SERVICES, LLC

SOUTHWESTERN BELL VIDEO SERVICES, INC.

AT&T YELLOW PAGES - SOUTHWEST

AT&T YELLOW PAGES – EST (SNET Information Services, Inc.)

AT&T OPERATIONS, INC.

AT&T TECHNICAL OPERATIONS (Out-region)

AT&T Corp.

Keep in mind only the above entities are participating. Bell South and Cingular do not participate and the Company could not tell us if and when they will participate.

The second document is called Intersubsidiary Movement Process Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) (imf_faqs.pdf). In this package you will find information on available jobs, eligibility, testing, wages, pensions and benefits. The company is still investigating term employee treatment under IMF. They have told us however, an employee whose time in title and/or location has been waived and granted hardship status in ATS, is eligible to participate in IMF.
